Class RegularManualTransmissionTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • RegularManualTransmissionTest

  • public class RegularManualTransmissionTest
extends java.lang.Object
    A JUnit test class for the @link{RegularManualTransmission} class.

      void testIncreaseSpeedErrorMaxSpeed()
      Case 22: Checks for the case where speed cannot be increased as it has already reached maximum speed limit of the vehicle.
      void testIncreaseSpeedIncreaseGear()
      Case 20: Checks for the case where speed is allowed to be increased but driver may increase the gear.
      void testIncreaseSpeedOk()
      Case 19: Checks for the case where speed is allowed to be increased with no need of increase in gear.
      void testIncrementSpeedBy1()
      Case 18: Tests for the case where speed is always incremented by 1.
      void testLowerGearSpeedLessThanHigherGearSpeed1()
      Case 8: Tests for the case where l1 should be less than l2, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.
      void testLowerGearSpeedLessThanHigherGearSpeed2()
      Case 9: Tests for the case where l2 should be less than l3, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.
      void testLowerGearSpeedLessThanHigherGearSpeed3()
      Case 10: Tests for the case where l3 should be less than l4, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.
      void testLowerGearSpeedLessThanHigherGearSpeed4()
      Case 11: Tests for the case where l4 should be less than l5, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.
      void testLowerSpeedLessThanEqualsHigher1()
      Case 3: Tests for the case where l1 should be less than or equal to h1, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.
      void testLowerSpeedLessThanEqualsHigher2()
      Case 4: Tests for the case where l2 should be less than or equal to h2, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.

      Case 5: Tests for the case where l3 should be less than or equal to h3, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.

      Case 7: Tests for the case where l5 should be less than or equal to h5, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.

      Case 2: Tests for the case where the lowest speed provided is 0.
      void testNegativeInputs()
      Case 1: Tests for the case where negative speeds cannot be given as input.
      void testOverlappingGears1()
      Case 12: Tests for the case where gears should be overlapping, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.
      void testOverlappingGears2()
      Case 13: Tests for the case where gears should be overlapping, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.
      void testOverlappingGears3()
      Case 14: Tests for the case where gears should be overlapping, i.e., lx+1, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.
      void testOverlappingGears4()
      Case 15: Tests for the case where gears should be overlapping, i.e., lx+1, otherwise it throws IllegalArgumentException.
      void testTransmissionInitialization()
      Case 16: Tests for the case where transmission object was created successfully with speed as 0, gear as 1, and messages as "OK: everything is OK.".
